alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Gallatin; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:52AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Wet snow down to elevations near 6500 feet across southern Gallatin, Madison and Beaverhead Counties through 9 AM MDT... A spring storm system continues to spread widespread precipitation across southwest Montana this morning with snow levels as low as around 6500 feet. Significant snow accumulation continues at elevations above 7000 feet, however some wet snow with accumulation up to 2 inches is possible this morning at elevations below 7000 feet in southern Gallatin, Madison and Beaverhead counties, including West Yellowstone, Raynolds Pass, Monida pass and Big Hole pass. Expect periods of lower visibility in falling snow across these areas this morning with road surfaces primarily remaining wet with some slush possible in periods of heavier precipitation. Locations impacted include... West Yellowstone, Monida Pass, Raynolds Pass and Big Hole Pass.
